txt.en:
'You have proven that you are worthy of my trust, [placeholder]. Now I would call upon you to aid us.

'The guards have sighted a strange Man outside Kafagur -- perhaps the outlander you spoke of before. Shúkurz left in hopes of talking to the man peacefully, but he has not returned.

'Grúshul will have more information.'
Zagdúr will need to be convinced that you mean no harm to the people of Kafagur.
You have helped the inhabitants of Kafagur.\n\nYou should return to Zagdúr in Kafagur and talk to her.
You should complete quests in Jeb Khâtel to win the Orcs' trust.

'Shúkurz's friendship with you means something to me, but I require some more convincing.

'Should you wish to stay in Kafagur, then help my people. Prove to me that you are someone worth trusting.

'If not, then heed my warning: leave us be.'
'Here to help your friend?\n\n'We saw the Man sneaking around near the trees, but he fled after Shúkurz tried to approach. Then the fool ignored my protests and ran after him!'
According to Zagdúr, a Man was sighted outside of Kafagur.\n\nYou should talk to the guard Grúshul for more information.
